param.name: useglobal
param.label: Use Global Settings
param.description: Use the global Joomla! LDAP settings

param.name: autocreate
param.label: Auto Create Users
param.description: Automatically created registered users where possible

param.name: forceldap
param.label: Force LDAP Authentication
param.description: Users Joomla password is reset upon unsuccessful bind. This ensures that new LDAP passwords are used, instead of old synchronized value.

param.name: use_ldapV3
param.label: LDAP V3
param.description: Default is LDAP2, but latest versions of OpenLdap require clients to use LDAPV3

param.name: negotiate_tls
param.label: Negociate TLS
param.description: Negotiate TLS encryption with the LDAP server. This requires all traffic to and from my LDAP server to be encrypted.

param.name: no_referrals
param.label: Don't follow referrals
param.description: This option clears the LDAP_OPT_REFERRALS flag.You'll need to check it for Windows 2003 servers.

param.name: base_dn
param.label: Base DN
param.description: The base DN of your LDAP server, e.g o=mydomain.com

param.name: connect
param.label: Connect string
param.description: The Connect String and Connect password define connection parameters for the DN lookup phase. 3 options are available:- Anonymous DN lookup. Leave both fields blank.- Administrative connection: 'Connect String' is the DN of an administrative account, e.g uid=admin,ou=users,o=mydomain.com. 'Connect password' is the actual password of your administrative account.- Connection with the user-supplied login/password: 'Connect String' is a DN, where the [login] token will be dynamically replaced by the user login, e.g uid=[login],ou=People,dc=my-domain,dc=com. param.name: search_string
param.label: Search string
param.description: A query string used for search for a given user. The [login] keyword is dynamically replaced by the user-provided login, so an example string is: uid=[login]. Several strings can be used, separated by semicolons.

param.name: users_dn
param.label: Users DN
param.description: The [login] keyword is dynamically replaced by the user-provided login, so an example string is: uid=[login], dc=my-domain, dc=com. Several strings can be used, separated by semicolons.

param.name: groupMap
param.label: Group Map
param.description: Maps LDAP Groups to Joomla! Groups
